critique: The document is an executive order focused on improving access to justice and efficiency in government civil litigation. It emphasizes pre-filing dispute resolution, settlement conferences, alternative dispute resolution methods, streamlined discovery, and sanctions for abusive practices. It also encourages pro bono service and aims to ensure legislation and regulations are clear and minimize litigation. The order promotes just and efficient administrative adjudications and emphasizes the elimination of bias. It applies only to civil matters and does not create private rights.
